title: GraphERE: Jointly Multiple Event-Event Relation Extraction via Graph-Enhanced Event Embeddings
abstract: arXiv:2403.12523v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Events describe the state changes of entities. In a document, multiple events are connected by various relations (e.g., Coreference, Temporal, Causal, and Subevent). Therefore, obtaining the connections between events through Event-Event Relation Extraction (ERE) is critical to understand natural language. There are two main problems in the current ERE works: a. Only embeddings of the event triggers are used for event feature representation, ignoring event arguments (e.g., time, place, person, etc.) and their structure within the event. b. The interconnection between relations (e.g., temporal and causal relations usually interact with each other ) is ignored. To solve the above problems, this paper proposes a jointly multiple ERE framework called GraphERE based on Graph-enhanced Event Embeddings. translated_title: GraphERE: 基于图增强事件嵌入的多事件关系提取
translated_abstract: 事件描述实体的状态变化。在文档中，多个事件通过各种关系相互连接（例如，共指、时间、因果和子事件）。因此，通过事件之间的关系提取（ERE）获取事件之间的连接对于理解自然语言至关重要。当前ERE工作中存在两个主要问题：a. 仅使用事件触发器的嵌入来表示事件特征，忽略事件参数（例如，时间、地点、人物等）及其在事件内的结构。b. 关系之间的互连（例如，时间和因果关系通常会相互影响）被忽略。为解决上述问题，本文提出了一种名为GraphERE基于图增强事件嵌入的多重ERE框架。首先，我们利用静态AMR图和IE图丰富事件嵌入的事件参数和结构特征；然后，为了联合...
tldr: 该论文提出了一种名为GraphERE的多事件关系提取框架，通过使用图增强事件嵌入，扩展了事件嵌入的事件参数和结构特征，从而解决了事件触发器嵌入的局限以及关系之间互连被忽略的问题。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces GraphERE, a framework for jointly multiple event-event relation extraction that enhances event embeddings with event argument and structure features, addressing the limitations of using only event triggers embeddings and ignoring the interconnection between relations.
